programming.label: Programming / Coding

beginnerResources.title: Automate the Boring Stuff with Python

intermediateResources.title: The Odin Project – Full Stack Path

exercises: Write a script that reads a CSV file and calculates summary statistics
Build a simple CLI tool that interacts with a public API
Create a personal portfolio website with HTML/CSS/JS
Implement a to-do list app with local storage

projectIdeas.title: Personal Budget Tracker
projectIdeas.description: Build a web app that tracks income and expenses with charts

projectIdeas.title: API-Powered Dashboard
projectIdeas.description: Create a dashboard that pulls data from a public API and displays it with visualizations

weeklyMilestones: Write and run your first program
Understand variables, loops, and functions
Build a small project from scratch
Learn version control with Git

data-analysis.label: Data Analysis
exercises: Clean and analyze a messy real-world dataset (e.g., Kaggle's Titanic dataset)
Create pivot tables and charts from sales data in a spreadsheet
Write SQL queries to answer business questions from a sample database
Build a data pipeline that automates a daily report

projectIdeas.title: COVID-19 Data Explorer
projectIdeas.description: Build an interactive dashboard analyzing publicly available COVID-19 data by region and time

projectIdeas.title: Survey Analysis Report
projectIdeas.description: Design a survey, collect responses, clean the data, and produce an insight report with charts

weeklyMilestones: Import and explore a dataset
Calculate descriptive statistics
Create meaningful visualizations
Tell a story with data

machine-learning.label: Machine Learning / AI
exercises: Train a linear regression model on a housing price dataset
Build a classification model to predict customer churn
Implement k-means clustering on a customer segmentation dataset
Fine-tune a pre-trained image classifier on a custom dataset

projectIdeas.title: Sentiment Analysis Tool
projectIdeas.description: Build a model that classifies social media posts as positive, negative, or neutral

projectIdeas.title: Recommendation Engine
projectIdeas.description: Create a movie/book recommendation system using collaborative filtering

weeklyMilestones: Understand supervised vs unsupervised learning
Train your first model and evaluate it
Handle feature engineering and data preprocessing
Deploy a model as a simple API

statistics.label: Statistics
exercises: Calculate confidence intervals for a sample dataset
Run a hypothesis test (t-test) on two groups
Create a correlation matrix and interpret the results
Perform a regression analysis and explain R-squared

projectIdeas.title: A/B Test Simulator
projectIdeas.description: Build a tool that simulates A/B tests with different sample sizes and effect sizes

weeklyMilestones: Understand distributions and probability
Calculate and interpret p-values
Run hypothesis tests confidently
Apply regression analysis to real data

research.label: Research

beginnerResources.title: How to Read a Scientific Paper

exercises: Write a literature review on a topic that interests you
Design a survey with 10 questions and test it with 5 people
Analyze an existing study's methodology and identify limitations
Synthesize findings from 3 papers into a one-page summary

projectIdeas.title: Mini Research Report
projectIdeas.description: Choose a question, design a study, collect data from 20+ people, and write up findings

weeklyMilestones: Formulate a research question
Design a methodology
Collect and organize data
Write and present findings

communication.label: Communication

intermediateResources.title: Made to Stick by Chip & Dan Heath

exercises: Write a one-page executive summary of a complex topic
Give a 5-minute presentation to a friend or family member and ask for feedback
Draft a professional email for three different audiences (technical, executive, customer)
Record yourself explaining a concept and review for clarity

projectIdeas.title: Explainer Blog Series
projectIdeas.description: Write 3 blog posts explaining a technical topic for a non-technical audience

weeklyMilestones: Identify your communication strengths and weaknesses
Practice structured writing (intro → body → conclusion)
Deliver a short presentation with visual aids
Get and incorporate peer feedback

design.label: Design / Visual Design

intermediateResources.title: Don't Make Me Think by Steve Krug

exercises: Redesign the homepage of a website you use frequently
Create a mood board for a hypothetical product
Design a mobile app screen in Figma with proper spacing and typography
Conduct a quick usability test with a friend on an existing app

projectIdeas.title: App Redesign Case Study
projectIdeas.description: Pick an app with poor UX, research user pain points, and design an improved version with mockups

weeklyMilestones: Learn design principles (contrast, alignment, repetition, proximity)
Create wireframes for a simple app
Build a high-fidelity mockup in Figma
Conduct a usability test and iterate

empathy.label: Empathy

beginnerResources.title: Empathy and Emotional Intelligence at Work
Empathy: Why It Matters by Roman Krznaric

exercises: Conduct 3 empathy interviews (15 min each) with people in different roles
Write a user persona based on a real conversation
Shadow someone in a different job for a day and document pain points
Practice active listening in every conversation for one week

projectIdeas.title: Empathy Map Collection
projectIdeas.description: Create empathy maps for 5 different user types based on interviews

weeklyMilestones: Practice active listening daily
Conduct your first empathy interview
Create a user persona from real data
Apply empathy insights to a design decision

writing.label: Writing

beginnerResources.title: On Writing Well by William Zinsser

exercises: Write a 500-word explanation of a concept you just learned
Edit a piece of writing to reduce word count by 30% without losing meaning
Write the same content for three different audiences
Create a step-by-step tutorial for a task you know well

projectIdeas.title: Technical Blog
projectIdeas.description: Start a blog and publish 4 articles explaining technical concepts clearly

weeklyMilestones: Establish a daily writing habit
Learn to self-edit ruthlessly
Write for a specific audience
Publish your first piece

critical-thinking.label: Critical Thinking

beginnerResources.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow by Daniel Kahneman

exercises: Analyze a news article: identify claims, evidence, assumptions, and logical fallacies
Take both sides of a debate and argue each persuasively
Break a complex problem into sub-problems and solve each one
Evaluate 3 competing solutions to a problem using a decision matrix

projectIdeas.title: Decision Framework
projectIdeas.description: Create a reusable decision-making framework and test it on 3 real decisions

weeklyMilestones: Identify cognitive biases in your own thinking
Practice structured argumentation
Apply frameworks to real-world problems
Make a complex decision using a formal method

biology.label: Biology / Life Sciences
exercises: Use NCBI BLAST to compare gene sequences
Analyze a gene expression dataset from GEO
Write a Python script to parse FASTA files
Create a phylogenetic tree from sequence data

projectIdeas.title: Gene Expression Analyzer
projectIdeas.description: Build a tool that visualizes gene expression differences between healthy and disease samples

weeklyMilestones: Understand DNA/RNA/protein relationships
Navigate biological databases (NCBI, UniProt)
Run a basic bioinformatics analysis
Interpret results in a biological context

psychology.label: Psychology
exercises: Observe and document 5 cognitive biases in everyday life
Design a behavioral experiment with a clear hypothesis
Analyze a product's UX through a psychological lens
Write a 1-page summary of a psychology research paper

projectIdeas.title: Behavioral Analysis Report
projectIdeas.description: Observe user behavior in a public space, apply psychological frameworks, and present insights

weeklyMilestones: Learn major psychological theories
Apply cognitive bias knowledge to real situations
Conduct a simple behavioral observation
Connect psychology to UX/product decisions

analytical-thinking.label: Analytical Thinking
exercises: Break a business problem into its component parts
Create a root cause analysis for a recent failure
Build a spreadsheet model to compare two business decisions
Present data-driven recommendations to a peer

projectIdeas.title: Market Analysis
projectIdeas.description: Research a market, quantify the opportunity, and present recommendations

weeklyMilestones: Learn structured problem-solving frameworks
Practice breaking complex problems into parts
Build analytical models in spreadsheets
Present analysis with clear recommendations

ethics.label: Ethics / Philosophy

beginnerResources.title: Ethics of AI – University of Helsinki

intermediateResources.title: Weapons of Math Destruction by Cathy O'Neil

exercises: Analyze an AI system for potential bias using an ethical framework
Write a data ethics policy for a hypothetical company
Debate both sides of a technology ethics dilemma
Review a real company's privacy policy and identify concerns

projectIdeas.title: AI Ethics Audit
projectIdeas.description: Select an AI product, audit it for fairness/bias/transparency, and write a recommendations report

weeklyMilestones: Learn major ethical frameworks
Apply ethics to technology decisions
Conduct an ethics review of a real product
Write and present ethical guidelines

gis.label: GIS / Mapping
exercises: Create a choropleth map of population density using QGIS
Build an interactive web map with Leaflet.js
Geocode a dataset of addresses and plot them
Analyze spatial data to find optimal locations for a service

projectIdeas.title: Neighborhood Analysis Dashboard
projectIdeas.description: Build an interactive map showing walkability, transit access, and amenities for a city

weeklyMilestones: Create your first map in QGIS
Work with coordinate systems and projections
Build an interactive web map
Perform a spatial analysis

visualization.label: Data Visualization

beginnerResources.title: Storytelling with Data by Cole Nussbaumer Knaflic

exercises: Recreate a famous data visualization (e.g., Minard's Napoleon march)
Build a dashboard with 3 linked charts in a tool of your choice
Create before/after versions of a poorly designed chart
Design an infographic summarizing a dataset

projectIdeas.title: Interactive Data Story
projectIdeas.description: Create a scrollytelling webpage that reveals insights from a dataset through animated charts

weeklyMilestones: Learn chart type selection principles
Create publication-quality static charts
Build interactive visualizations
Tell a complete story with data

problem-solving.label: Problem Solving
exercises: Use the 5 Whys technique on a problem you recently faced
Solve 3 logic puzzles from a puzzle book or website
Apply design thinking (empathize, define, ideate, prototype, test) to a real problem
Create a decision tree for a complex choice

projectIdeas.title: Process Improvement Report
projectIdeas.description: Identify an inefficient process, analyze root causes, propose solutions, and measure results

weeklyMilestones: Learn structured problem-solving frameworks
Practice decomposing complex problems
Apply creative ideation techniques
Present a well-reasoned solution

attention-to-detail.label: Attention to Detail
exercises: Review a document and find all formatting inconsistencies
Audit a spreadsheet for formula errors
Create a checklist for a regular process and verify each step
Compare two versions of a document and list all differences

projectIdeas.title: Quality Assurance Checklist
projectIdeas.description: Design a comprehensive QA checklist for a workflow and test it on real work

weeklyMilestones: Build a personal checklist system
Practice systematic review techniques
Develop proofreading habits
Apply detail-orientation to a real project

project-management.label: Project Management

intermediateResources.title: The Lean Startup by Eric Ries

exercises: Create a project plan with milestones, tasks, and deadlines for a personal goal
Run a 1-week sprint using a Kanban board
Conduct a retrospective on a completed project
Manage scope creep by prioritizing features using MoSCoW

projectIdeas.title: Event Planner
projectIdeas.description: Plan and execute a small event (meetup, workshop) from start to finish documenting the PM process

weeklyMilestones: Create a project charter and timeline
Set up a task management system
Practice sprint planning and reviews
Deliver a project on time

leadership.label: Leadership

intermediateResources.title: Leaders Eat Last by Simon Sinek

exercises: Lead a small group discussion or meeting
Mentor someone junior in a skill you're strong in
Practice giving constructive feedback using the SBI model
Organize and lead a volunteer initiative

projectIdeas.title: Team Project Lead
projectIdeas.description: Lead a small team on a project (hackathon, volunteer work, study group) and document your leadership approach

weeklyMilestones: Understand your leadership style
Practice delegation and feedback
Lead a small team initiative
Reflect on and refine your approach

interviewing.label: Interviewing & User Research

beginnerResources.title: UX Research at Scale: Surveys, Analytics, Online Testing

exercises: Write a discussion guide with 10 open-ended questions for a product you use daily
Conduct a 30-minute user interview with a friend about their experience with a specific app
Transcribe a recorded interview and code it for themes using affinity mapping
Create a research report summarizing findings from 3 mock interviews with actionable recommendations

projectIdeas.title: User Research Study
projectIdeas.description: Recruit 5 participants, conduct semi-structured interviews about a product or service, synthesize findings into personas and a research report

projectIdeas.title: Usability Test & Report
projectIdeas.description: Design a usability test for an existing website, run it with 3-5 participants, and present findings with severity ratings and recommendations

weeklyMilestones: Learn question types and practice writing non-leading open-ended questions
Conduct your first moderated user interview and take structured notes
Synthesize interview data using affinity diagrams and thematic analysis
Present research findings with evidence-based recommendations

technical-literacy.label: Technical Literacy

beginnerResources.title: Base CS – Exploring Computer Science Fundamentals

intermediateResources.title: The Non-Technical Guide to Web Technologies

exercises: Diagram how a web request flows from browser to server and back, labeling DNS, HTTP, and server components
Set up a simple HTML page and deploy it using GitHub Pages, documenting each step
Read the API documentation of a service you use (e.g., Slack or Stripe) and explain three endpoints in plain language
Attend a sprint planning or standup meeting and create a glossary of all technical terms used

projectIdeas.title: Tech Glossary for Non-Developers
projectIdeas.description: Create a living glossary document of 50+ technical terms with plain-language definitions, real-world analogies, and example usage

projectIdeas.title: Architecture Explainer
projectIdeas.description: Research how a popular application (e.g., Netflix, Spotify) works technically and create a visual explainer with diagrams

weeklyMilestones: Understand how the internet, browsers, and servers work at a high level
Learn to read basic code and understand version control concepts
Navigate developer tools, read API docs, and understand databases conceptually
Confidently participate in technical discussions and translate between technical and business language

policy.label: Policy Analysis & Development

beginnerResources.title: Public Policy Challenges of the 21st Century
Policy Analysis Using Interrupted Time Series
How to Write a Policy Brief

intermediateResources.title: Policy Analysis: Concepts and Practice by David Weimer

exercises: Write a 2-page policy brief on a local issue, including problem statement, evidence, and 3 policy options with trade-offs
Conduct a stakeholder analysis for a proposed regulation, mapping interests, influence, and positions
Compare policies from two different countries addressing the same issue (e.g., carbon tax approaches) and summarize strengths and weaknesses
Analyze the unintended consequences of a historical policy decision using primary and secondary sources

projectIdeas.title: Policy Impact Assessment
projectIdeas.description: Select a current policy proposal, gather data on its likely impacts, interview 3 stakeholders, and produce a comprehensive analysis report with recommendations

weeklyMilestones: Learn policy analysis frameworks (cost-benefit, stakeholder, SWOT)
Write a structured policy brief using real data and evidence
Conduct stakeholder analysis and map competing interests
Present a policy recommendation with supporting evidence and implementation plan

philosophy.label: Philosophy & Ethics Reasoning

beginnerResources.title: Think Again: How to Reason and Argue

intermediateResources.title: Justice: What's the Right Thing to Do? by Michael Sandel

exercises: Reconstruct the argument structure of a published op-ed, identifying premises, conclusions, and logical fallacies
Write a 1-page ethical analysis of a technology dilemma (e.g., facial recognition in policing) using two different ethical frameworks
Create a Socratic dialogue between two characters debating whether AI should make life-or-death medical decisions
Analyze a corporate code of ethics and identify gaps or contradictions using deontological and consequentialist perspectives

projectIdeas.title: Ethics Case Study Portfolio
projectIdeas.description: Write 4 detailed case studies analyzing real-world ethical dilemmas, each applying a different ethical framework (utilitarianism, deontology, virtue ethics, care ethics)

weeklyMilestones: Understand major ethical frameworks: consequentialism, deontology, virtue ethics
Practice identifying and evaluating arguments for validity and soundness
Apply ethical reasoning to real-world technology and business scenarios
Write a structured philosophical argument with clear premises and conclusions

public-speaking.label: Public Speaking & Presentations

beginnerResources.title: TED Talks: The Official TED Guide to Public Speaking

intermediateResources.title: Talk Like TED by Carmine Gallo

exercises: Record yourself giving a 3-minute talk on a topic you know well, review it, and note filler words and body language habits
Design a 10-slide presentation following the 10/20/30 rule and present it to a friend for feedback
Practice impromptu speaking by randomly selecting a topic and speaking about it for 2 minutes without preparation
Deliver the same 5-minute presentation three times, each time incorporating feedback from the previous round

projectIdeas.title: Lightning Talk Series
projectIdeas.description: Prepare and deliver three 5-minute lightning talks on different topics at a meetup, lunch-and-learn, or to friends, recording each for self-review

projectIdeas.title: Conference Talk Proposal
projectIdeas.description: Write a conference talk proposal, create a slide deck, rehearse 5 times, and deliver the full 20-minute talk to a practice audience

weeklyMilestones: Overcome initial anxiety with a recorded 2-minute self-introduction
Structure a talk with a clear hook, body, and memorable close
Practice vocal variety, pacing, and purposeful body language
Deliver a polished 10-minute presentation and incorporate audience feedback

teaching.label: Teaching & Instruction

beginnerResources.title: How People Learn – Summary of National Academies Report

intermediateResources.title: Make It Stick: The Science of Successful Learning

exercises: Create a 30-minute lesson plan on a topic you know, including learning objectives, activities, and an assessment
Teach a skill to a friend using the I Do / We Do / You Do scaffolding technique and collect their feedback
Design three different explanations for the same concept targeted at beginner, intermediate, and expert audiences
Record a 10-minute instructional video with visual aids and review it for clarity of explanation

projectIdeas.title: Mini Workshop
projectIdeas.description: Design and deliver a 1-hour workshop on a skill you know well, including hands-on exercises, to at least 5 participants, then collect and analyze feedback

projectIdeas.title: Online Tutorial Series
projectIdeas.description: Create a 4-part written or video tutorial series teaching a skill from scratch, with progressive complexity and practice exercises

weeklyMilestones: Write a lesson plan with clear learning objectives and success criteria
Deliver a short lesson using active learning techniques and check for understanding
Design formative assessments that reveal learner misconceptions
Iterate on instruction based on learner feedback and assessment results

environmental-science.label: Environmental Science

beginnerResources.title: Climate Change: The Science and Global Impact

exercises: Calculate your personal carbon footprint using three different online calculators and compare the methodologies
Analyze local air quality data from the EPA AirNow database and create a weekly trend chart
Map environmental justice hotspots in your county using EPA EJSCREEN data
Write a 2-page impact assessment for a proposed development project near a wetland

projectIdeas.title: Local Environmental Audit
projectIdeas.description: Conduct an environmental audit of your neighborhood: measure waste, map green spaces, analyze water quality data, and create an improvement proposal with cost estimates

projectIdeas.title: Sustainability Dashboard
projectIdeas.description: Build a data dashboard tracking key environmental indicators (carbon emissions, deforestation, ocean health) using publicly available datasets

weeklyMilestones: Understand key environmental systems: carbon cycle, water cycle, biodiversity
Learn to read and interpret environmental data and scientific reports
Conduct a basic environmental assessment using real data and tools
Present environmental findings with actionable policy or behavioral recommendations

accounting.label: Accounting & Financial Analysis
exercises: Create a complete income statement, balance sheet, and cash flow statement for a fictional small business with 20 transactions
Calculate and interpret 5 key financial ratios (current ratio, debt-to-equity, ROE, gross margin, operating margin) from a real public company's 10-K filing
Reconcile a mock bank statement with a general ledger, identifying and correcting 5 discrepancies
Prepare a monthly budget vs. actuals variance analysis with explanations for each line item variance

projectIdeas.title: Company Financial Health Report
projectIdeas.description: Select a public company, analyze its last 3 years of financial statements, calculate key ratios, identify trends, and write a financial health assessment

projectIdeas.title: Small Business Bookkeeping System
projectIdeas.description: Set up a complete bookkeeping system for a real or simulated small business using spreadsheets, including chart of accounts, journal entries, and monthly closing process

weeklyMilestones: Understand the accounting equation and double-entry bookkeeping fundamentals
Read and interpret income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements
Perform financial ratio analysis and trend analysis on real company data
Prepare a complete set of financial statements and explain them to a non-financial audience

investigation.label: Investigation & Forensic Analysis
exercises: Conduct an OSINT investigation on yourself: find all publicly available information using only search engines and public records
Analyze metadata from 10 sample image files to extract timestamps, GPS coordinates, and device information
Create a timeline of events from a mock case file containing emails, log entries, and witness statements
Verify the authenticity of 5 social media posts using reverse image search, metadata analysis, and cross-referencing

projectIdeas.title: OSINT Investigation Report
projectIdeas.description: Choose a publicly available case (e.g., from Trace Labs), conduct a thorough open-source investigation, document methodology, and write a structured findings report

projectIdeas.title: Digital Forensics Lab
projectIdeas.description: Download a forensic disk image from a CTF challenge, analyze it using Autopsy, document the chain of evidence, and present findings in a formal forensic report

weeklyMilestones: Learn OSINT fundamentals and master search operators for Google, social media, and public records
Practice evidence collection with proper documentation and chain-of-custody procedures
Analyze digital artifacts (metadata, logs, file systems) to reconstruct timelines
Write a complete investigation report with methodology, evidence, findings, and conclusions

testing.label: Software Testing & QA
exercises: Write test cases for a login page covering valid credentials, invalid credentials, empty fields, SQL injection, and session management
Set up a test automation framework using Cypress or Selenium for a sample web application and write 10 automated test scripts
Perform exploratory testing on a public website for 60 minutes and file 5 structured bug reports with steps to reproduce, expected vs. actual results, and severity
Create a test plan for a mobile app feature including scope, approach, test types (functional, regression, performance), and exit criteria

projectIdeas.title: Automated Test Suite
projectIdeas.description: Build a comprehensive automated test suite for an open-source web application including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests with CI/CD integration

projectIdeas.title: QA Process Documentation
projectIdeas.description: Design a complete QA process for a development team including test strategy, bug reporting templates, regression test plan, and release checklist

weeklyMilestones: Learn testing fundamentals: test levels, types, and techniques (equivalence partitioning, boundary value analysis)
Write structured test cases and bug reports for a real application
Set up and write automated tests using Cypress or Selenium
Design a test plan and integrate automated tests into a CI/CD pipeline

mathematics.label: Mathematics & Applied Math
exercises: Solve 10 linear algebra problems involving matrix multiplication, eigenvalues, and vector spaces by hand and verify with NumPy
Model a real-world problem (e.g., population growth, compound interest) using differential equations and graph the solutions
Implement 3 optimization algorithms (gradient descent, Newton's method, simplex) from scratch in Python
Write proofs for 5 fundamental theorems (e.g., Pythagorean theorem, fundamental theorem of calculus) using different proof techniques

projectIdeas.title: Mathematical Modeling Project
projectIdeas.description: Choose a real-world phenomenon (epidemic spread, traffic flow, stock prices), model it mathematically, simulate it in Python, and validate against real data

projectIdeas.title: Linear Algebra Visualizer
projectIdeas.description: Build an interactive web tool that visualizes matrix transformations, eigenvectors, and vector spaces in 2D and 3D

weeklyMilestones: Review algebra and trigonometry fundamentals; solve practice problem sets
Learn core linear algebra: vectors, matrices, transformations, and eigenvalues
Study calculus concepts: derivatives, integrals, and optimization
Apply mathematical concepts to real-world problems using programming

3d-modeling.label: 3D Modeling & Animation
exercises: Model a detailed coffee mug in Blender with accurate proportions, materials, and a studio lighting setup
Create a low-poly character model with proper topology suitable for animation (under 5,000 polygons)
UV unwrap a complex object and create a custom texture in a painting tool, then apply it in Blender
Animate a 10-second walk cycle for a rigged character following the 12 principles of animation

projectIdeas.title: 3D Environment Scene
projectIdeas.description: Design and model a complete 3D environment (room, street, or landscape) with props, lighting, textures, and a rendered final image or flythrough video

projectIdeas.title: Product Visualization Reel
projectIdeas.description: Create photorealistic 3D renders of 5 consumer products with studio lighting, materials, and turntable animations suitable for a portfolio

weeklyMilestones: Navigate the Blender UI and create primitive shapes with basic modifiers
Model a complete hard-surface object with proper topology and materials
Learn UV mapping, texturing, and lighting for realistic renders
Rig a simple character and create a basic animation with keyframes

accessibility.label: Accessibility & Inclusive Design

beginnerResources.title: An Introduction to Accessibility and Inclusive Design

exercises: Audit a public website using axe DevTools and WAVE, document all WCAG violations, and propose fixes for each issue
Navigate a website using only a keyboard and a screen reader (NVDA or VoiceOver) for 30 minutes, documenting barriers encountered
Refactor a web page to fix 10 accessibility issues: add alt text, ARIA labels, focus management, color contrast, and semantic HTML
Create an accessible form with proper labels, error handling, focus management, and screen reader announcements

projectIdeas.title: Accessibility Audit Report
projectIdeas.description: Conduct a WCAG 2.1 AA audit of a complete website, test with assistive technologies, document all findings with severity ratings, and produce a remediation roadmap

projectIdeas.title: Inclusive Component Library
projectIdeas.description: Build an accessible component library (buttons, modals, tabs, accordions, dropdowns) that passes WCAG 2.1 AA with documentation and usage guidelines

weeklyMilestones: Learn WCAG principles (POUR: Perceivable, Operable, Understandable, Robust) and common accessibility issues
Use screen readers and keyboard-only navigation to identify barriers
Fix real accessibility issues using semantic HTML, ARIA, and CSS
Conduct a full WCAG audit and write a remediation plan with priorities

prototyping.label: Prototyping & Wireframing

beginnerResources.title: UX Design: From Wireframe to Prototype

exercises: Sketch 3 different layout variations for a mobile onboarding flow using paper and pen within 15 minutes
Build a clickable prototype in Figma for a food delivery app with at least 8 screens and realistic navigation flows
Create a wireframe kit with reusable components (buttons, inputs, cards, navigation) in Figma and organize it as a component library
Conduct a prototype walkthrough with 3 users, noting where they get confused, and iterate on the design based on findings

projectIdeas.title: Mobile App Prototype
projectIdeas.description: Design a complete mobile app prototype in Figma from research to interactive prototype, including user flows, wireframes, and high-fidelity screens with animations

projectIdeas.title: Rapid Prototyping Sprint
projectIdeas.description: In one week, prototype 5 different solution concepts for a single user problem, test each with 2 users, and present a comparison

weeklyMilestones: Learn wireframing fundamentals: layout grids, information hierarchy, and user flow diagrams
Build low-fidelity wireframes for a complete user journey in Figma
Create high-fidelity interactive prototypes with transitions and micro-interactions
Test prototypes with real users and iterate based on observed pain points

healthcare-knowledge.label: Healthcare & Clinical Knowledge

beginnerResources.title: Introduction to the U.S. Healthcare System

exercises: Map a patient journey through a typical primary care visit, identifying every touchpoint, data exchange, and handoff
Compare healthcare systems of 3 countries (e.g., US, UK, Singapore) on cost, outcomes, and access using OECD data
Read and summarize 3 clinical trial abstracts from PubMed, explaining methodology, results, and limitations in plain language
Create a flowchart for a clinical decision workflow (e.g., diabetes screening) using published clinical guidelines

projectIdeas.title: Patient Experience Research
projectIdeas.description: Interview 5 patients or caregivers about their healthcare experiences, identify common pain points, and propose 3 design interventions with supporting evidence

projectIdeas.title: Health Data Dashboard
projectIdeas.description: Build a dashboard visualizing public health data (CDC, WHO) for a specific condition, with trend analysis and demographic breakdowns

weeklyMilestones: Understand healthcare system structure: payers, providers, regulations (HIPAA, ICD-10)
Learn clinical terminology and how to read medical literature and guidelines
Analyze healthcare data using public databases (CDC WONDER, OECD Health Statistics)
Apply healthcare knowledge to a project addressing a real patient or system challenge

strategy.label: Strategic Thinking & Planning

beginnerResources.title: Good Strategy Bad Strategy by Richard Rumelt

exercises: Conduct a SWOT analysis and Porter's Five Forces analysis for a company in an industry you follow
Write a 3-year strategic plan for a hypothetical startup, including vision, goals, key metrics, and resource allocation
Analyze a real company's pivot (e.g., Netflix from DVDs to streaming) and map the strategic decisions and trade-offs involved
Create a competitive landscape map for an industry with 10+ players, identifying strategic groups and white spaces

projectIdeas.title: Strategic Analysis Report
projectIdeas.description: Choose a public company, analyze its strategy using multiple frameworks (SWOT, Five Forces, Value Chain), assess competitive position, and present strategic recommendations

projectIdeas.title: Business Model Canvas Workshop
projectIdeas.description: Design business model canvases for 3 different startup ideas, validate assumptions with customer interviews, and present the strongest opportunity

weeklyMilestones: Learn core strategy frameworks: SWOT, Porter's Five Forces, Value Chain Analysis
Apply strategy frameworks to analyze a real company or industry
Develop a strategic plan with goals, metrics, and resource priorities
Present strategic recommendations with supporting evidence and implementation roadmap

technology.label: Technology Fundamentals

intermediateResources.title: Hacker News – Stay Current on Technology

exercises: Set up a virtual machine using VirtualBox, install an operating system, and configure basic networking
Explain how 5 everyday technologies work at a high level (GPS, Wi-Fi, encryption, cloud storage, streaming) in a 1-page document each
Compare 3 cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and map their equivalent services for compute, storage, and databases
Build a personal home lab: set up a NAS, configure a router, and implement basic network security

projectIdeas.title: Technology Landscape Report
projectIdeas.description: Research and map the technology landscape for a specific industry, identify key trends, evaluate emerging technologies, and predict impact over 3-5 years

projectIdeas.title: Home Lab Setup
projectIdeas.description: Build a home technology lab with a server, network storage, and development environment, documenting the architecture and setup process

weeklyMilestones: Understand core computing concepts: hardware, software, operating systems, and binary
Learn how networks, the internet, and cloud computing work at a conceptual level
Explore databases, APIs, and how applications are built and deployed
Stay current by reading tech news and evaluating new technologies critically

ui-design.label: UI Design & Visual Systems
exercises: Create a design system with a type scale (6 sizes), color palette (primary, secondary, neutral, semantic colors), and 8px spacing grid in Figma
Redesign 3 screens of a popular app following Material Design or Apple HIG guidelines and document your design decisions
Design a dark mode and light mode variant for a dashboard UI with proper contrast ratios and consistent component styling
Create a reusable component library in Figma with variants for buttons, inputs, cards, and navigation with auto-layout

projectIdeas.title: Design System
projectIdeas.description: Create a comprehensive design system in Figma with foundations (color, typography, spacing, icons), components (30+ with states and variants), and documentation pages

projectIdeas.title: App Redesign Case Study
projectIdeas.description: Redesign an existing application with a focus on visual hierarchy, consistency, and brand alignment; create before/after comparisons and explain design rationale

weeklyMilestones: Learn visual design fundamentals: typography, color theory, spacing, and hierarchy
Study design systems (Material Design, Apple HIG) and understand component patterns
Build a color palette, type scale, and component library in Figma
Design a complete multi-screen interface with a consistent visual system

cloud-computing.label: Cloud Computing
exercises: Deploy a static website using AWS S3 and CloudFront with a custom domain and HTTPS certificate
Set up a VPC with public and private subnets, NAT gateway, security groups, and deploy an EC2 instance in each
Create a serverless API using AWS Lambda, API Gateway, and DynamoDB that handles CRUD operations
Set up monitoring and alerting for a cloud application using CloudWatch dashboards, alarms, and SNS notifications

projectIdeas.title: Cloud-Native Web Application
projectIdeas.description: Architect and deploy a scalable web application on AWS using EC2/ECS, RDS, S3, CloudFront, and Route 53 with auto-scaling and load balancing

projectIdeas.title: Multi-Cloud Cost Comparison
projectIdeas.description: Deploy the same application on AWS, Azure, and GCP; compare pricing, performance, and developer experience; produce a recommendation report

weeklyMilestones: Understand cloud computing models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS), pricing, and shared responsibility
Deploy virtual machines, configure networking, and manage storage in a cloud platform
Build serverless applications with managed services (Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB)
Architect a production-ready cloud solution with security, monitoring, and cost optimization

devops.label: DevOps & CI/CD
exercises: Write a Dockerfile for a Node.js application with multi-stage builds, health checks, and a non-root user
Create a GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline that runs tests, builds a Docker image, and deploys to a staging environment on every push
Set up a docker-compose environment with a web app, database, and Redis cache with persistent volumes and proper networking
Implement infrastructure as code using Terraform to provision an AWS EC2 instance with security groups and an Elastic IP

projectIdeas.title: Full CI/CD Pipeline
projectIdeas.description: Build a complete CI/CD pipeline for a microservices application: automated testing, Docker builds, container registry, staging and production deployments with rollback capability

projectIdeas.title: Infrastructure as Code Project
projectIdeas.description: Define an entire application infrastructure using Terraform or Pulumi: networking, compute, database, monitoring, and deploy it reproducibly from scratch

weeklyMilestones: Learn DevOps principles, containerize an application with Docker, and run it locally
Build CI/CD pipelines with GitHub Actions or Jenkins for automated testing and deployment
Orchestrate containers with Docker Compose and learn Kubernetes fundamentals
Implement infrastructure as code and set up monitoring, logging, and alerting

automation.label: Automation & Scripting

beginnerResources.title: Automate the Boring Stuff with Python

intermediateResources.title: Using Python to Interact with the Operating System

exercises: Write a Python script that monitors a folder for new files, renames them by date, and moves them to organized subdirectories
Build a web scraper that extracts product prices from 3 e-commerce sites and sends a daily email report of price changes
Create a bash script that backs up specified directories, compresses them with timestamps, and deletes backups older than 30 days
Automate a repetitive spreadsheet task: read data from multiple CSV files, clean and merge them, and generate a formatted Excel report

projectIdeas.title: Personal Automation Suite
projectIdeas.description: Identify 5 repetitive tasks in your daily workflow and automate each one with Python scripts, including error handling, logging, and scheduling with cron or Task Scheduler

projectIdeas.title: Data Pipeline Automator
projectIdeas.description: Build an automated data pipeline that scrapes data from public sources, cleans and transforms it, stores it in a database, and generates daily reports

weeklyMilestones: Write Python scripts for file manipulation, text processing, and data extraction
Automate web tasks with Selenium and API interactions with the requests library
Write bash scripts for system administration tasks and schedule them with cron
Build an end-to-end automation pipeline with error handling, logging, and notifications

linux.label: Linux & System Administration

intermediateResources.title: The Linux Command Line by William Shotts

exercises: Install Ubuntu in a VM, configure user accounts with proper permissions, and set up SSH key-based authentication
Write a bash script that monitors system resources (CPU, memory, disk) and sends alerts when thresholds are exceeded
Configure an Nginx web server on Linux to serve a static website with SSL/TLS using Let's Encrypt
Set up automated backups using rsync with scheduled cron jobs and log rotation

projectIdeas.title: Linux Web Server
projectIdeas.description: Set up a production-ready Linux server running Nginx, configure firewall rules with UFW, implement fail2ban, set up log monitoring, and deploy a web application

projectIdeas.title: System Administration Toolkit
projectIdeas.description: Create a collection of 10 bash scripts for common sysadmin tasks: user management, log analysis, backup, monitoring, and security hardening

weeklyMilestones: Navigate the file system, manage files, and use essential commands (grep, find, sed, awk)
Manage users, permissions, processes, and install software with package managers
Configure networking, services (SSH, Nginx, cron), and basic firewall rules
Write bash scripts for automation and set up monitoring and backups

computer-networking.label: Computer Networking & Infrastructure

beginnerResources.title: The Bits and Bytes of Computer Networking

exercises: Use Wireshark to capture and analyze TCP/IP packets during a web browsing session, identifying the 3-way handshake, HTTP requests, and DNS lookups
Subnet a /24 network into 4 subnets, calculate the valid host ranges, and diagram the network topology with proper addressing
Set up a home network lab with VLANs, DHCP, and DNS using Cisco Packet Tracer or GNS3
Troubleshoot a network connectivity issue using ping, traceroute, nslookup, and netstat, documenting each diagnostic step

projectIdeas.title: Network Design Project
projectIdeas.description: Design a complete network architecture for a small office (50 users): create a topology diagram, IP addressing scheme, VLAN plan, firewall rules, and Wi-Fi deployment plan

projectIdeas.title: Network Monitoring Dashboard
projectIdeas.description: Set up a network monitoring system using open-source tools (Nagios, Zabbix, or Grafana/Prometheus) to monitor bandwidth, latency, and device health

weeklyMilestones: Understand the OSI model, TCP/IP stack, and how data flows across networks
Learn IP addressing, subnetting, and routing fundamentals with hands-on practice
Analyze network traffic with Wireshark and troubleshoot common connectivity issues
Design and implement a multi-subnet network with DNS, DHCP, and firewall rules

digital-marketing.label: Digital Marketing & Analytics
exercises: Conduct a complete SEO audit for a website: analyze on-page SEO, backlinks, page speed, mobile-friendliness, and create a prioritized optimization plan
Set up a Google Analytics 4 property, configure 5 custom events, and build a conversion tracking report
Create a 30-day social media content calendar for a brand with post copy, visuals, hashtag strategy, and posting schedule for 3 platforms
Run an A/B test on email subject lines with at least 100 recipients per variant and analyze the results for statistical significance

projectIdeas.title: Digital Marketing Campaign
projectIdeas.description: Plan and execute a complete digital marketing campaign for a real or hypothetical product: market research, channel strategy, content creation, ad setup, and performance analytics

projectIdeas.title: Marketing Analytics Dashboard
projectIdeas.description: Build a marketing analytics dashboard in Google Data Studio or Looker connecting multiple data sources (Google Analytics, social media, email) with KPI tracking

weeklyMilestones: Understand the digital marketing funnel and core channels (SEO, SEM, social, email)
Set up Google Analytics, Search Console, and track key conversion metrics
Create content for social media and email campaigns with A/B testing
Analyze campaign performance data and optimize based on ROI metrics

cybersecurity.label: Cybersecurity & Information Security
exercises: Set up a vulnerable virtual machine (DVWA or Metasploitable) and practice identifying and exploiting the OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities
Configure a firewall on a Linux server, set up fail2ban, and test the rules by simulating a brute-force attack
Perform a vulnerability scan on your home network using Nmap and OpenVAS, then write a remediation report
Analyze a PCAP file containing a network attack, identify the attack vector, timeline, and compromised systems

projectIdeas.title: Home Lab Security Setup
projectIdeas.description: Build a cybersecurity home lab with pfSense firewall, Kali Linux, vulnerable VMs, and a SIEM (Wazuh or ELK); document and practice common attack/defense scenarios

projectIdeas.title: Security Assessment Report
projectIdeas.description: Perform a security assessment of a small business or personal setup: network scan, vulnerability assessment, policy review, and produce a professional security report with recommendations

weeklyMilestones: Understand security fundamentals: CIA triad, authentication, encryption, and common attack types
Practice with hands-on labs on TryHackMe: network scanning, exploitation basics, and log analysis
Set up defensive tools (firewalls, IDS, SIEM) and learn incident response procedures
Conduct a vulnerability assessment and write a professional security report

education-theory.label: Education Theory & Pedagogy

beginnerResources.title: Pedagogy of the Oppressed by Paulo Freire

intermediateResources.title: Understanding by Design by Wiggins & McTighe

exercises: Compare and contrast Bloom's Taxonomy, Constructivism, and Connectivism in a 2-page essay with real classroom examples
Design a curriculum unit using backward design (Understanding by Design): start with desired outcomes, determine assessments, then plan learning activities
Observe a class or training session, then analyze the teaching methods used against Kolb's experiential learning cycle
Create rubrics for 3 different assessment types (project, presentation, written report) with clear criteria and performance levels

projectIdeas.title: Curriculum Design Project
projectIdeas.description: Design a complete 8-week curriculum for a subject, including learning objectives mapped to Bloom's Taxonomy, lesson plans, assessments, and differentiation strategies

projectIdeas.title: Learning Experience Evaluation
projectIdeas.description: Evaluate an existing online course or training program using educational theory frameworks, conduct learner interviews, and write a redesign proposal

weeklyMilestones: Study major learning theories: behaviorism, cognitivism, constructivism, and connectivism
Learn instructional design models: ADDIE, backward design, and Bloom's Taxonomy
Design assessments aligned with learning objectives at multiple cognitive levels
Create a complete lesson plan applying evidence-based pedagogical strategies

sports-science.label: Sports Science & Analytics

beginnerResources.title: Exercise Physiology: Understanding the Athlete Within

exercises: Analyze a season's worth of NBA or soccer player statistics to identify undervalued players using efficiency metrics
Build a regression model to predict race finishing times based on training data (pace, mileage, elevation)
Create a training load monitoring dashboard that tracks volume, intensity, and acute-to-chronic workload ratio
Design a data-driven scouting report for a sports team, comparing 10 prospects across key performance indicators

projectIdeas.title: Sports Analytics Dashboard
projectIdeas.description: Build an interactive dashboard analyzing a full season of sports data with player comparisons, team performance trends, and predictive models

projectIdeas.title: Training Program Optimizer
projectIdeas.description: Design an evidence-based training program for an athlete, incorporating periodization, load monitoring, and performance benchmarks with automated tracking

weeklyMilestones: Learn exercise physiology fundamentals and key sports performance metrics
Collect and clean sports data from public sources (ESPN, Basketball Reference)
Build statistical models to evaluate player performance and predict outcomes
Create visualizations and reports that translate data into actionable coaching insights

supply-chain.label: Supply Chain & Operations

intermediateResources.title: The Goal by Eliyahu M. Goldratt

exercises: Map the end-to-end supply chain for a product you own, from raw materials to final delivery, identifying 10+ nodes and lead times
Calculate Economic Order Quantity (EOQ) and reorder points for 5 products using real or simulated demand data
Build a demand forecasting model using 12 months of historical sales data with moving averages and exponential smoothing
Conduct a bottleneck analysis on a process using Theory of Constraints and propose 3 improvement strategies

projectIdeas.title: Supply Chain Simulation
projectIdeas.description: Build a supply chain simulation in Python or Excel that models inventory levels, lead times, demand variability, and calculates optimal safety stock and reorder points

projectIdeas.title: Process Optimization Study
projectIdeas.description: Select a real or hypothetical manufacturing/logistics process, map it end-to-end, identify bottlenecks and waste using Lean principles, and present an improvement plan with projected savings

weeklyMilestones: Understand supply chain fundamentals: procurement, manufacturing, logistics, and distribution
Learn inventory management models: EOQ, safety stock, and ABC analysis
Apply forecasting techniques and analyze supply chain data for bottlenecks
Design a supply chain optimization plan with measurable KPIs and cost projections

storytelling.label: Storytelling & Narrative Design

beginnerResources.title: Storytelling and Influencing: Communicate with Impact
Building a StoryBrand by Donald Miller

exercises: Rewrite a dull product description as a customer story using the hero's journey framework in under 200 words
Create 3 different narrative arcs for the same brand message: problem-solution, before-after, and customer journey
Write a 2-minute brand origin story for a hypothetical company and deliver it on camera
Analyze the storytelling structure of 3 successful TED Talks and identify the narrative techniques used (hook, tension, resolution)

projectIdeas.title: Brand Storytelling Guide
projectIdeas.description: Create a comprehensive storytelling guide for a brand, including brand narrative, customer stories, messaging framework, and templates for different channels (web, email, social)

projectIdeas.title: Narrative Content Series
projectIdeas.description: Write a 5-part narrative content series (blog, video script, or podcast) that tells a compelling brand or educational story with a consistent arc

weeklyMilestones: Learn narrative structures: hero's journey, three-act structure, and the StoryBrand framework
Practice writing stories with clear characters, conflict, and resolution
Adapt storytelling techniques for different media: written, spoken, and visual
Create a portfolio of 3 stories that demonstrate different narrative approaches

content-strategy.label: Content Strategy & Marketing

beginnerResources.title: Content Strategy Basics – Moz Beginner's Guide

intermediateResources.title: Content Strategy for the Web by Kristina Halvorson

exercises: Conduct a content audit of a website with 50+ pages: inventory all content, score it on relevance and quality, and create a keep/improve/remove plan
Create a persona-driven content map that matches content types to each stage of the buyer's journey (awareness, consideration, decision)
Write a quarterly content calendar with 30 pieces of content across blog, email, and social media, each tied to a specific business objective
Analyze the top 10 performing pieces of content from a competitor and identify the content themes, formats, and distribution patterns that drive engagement

projectIdeas.title: Content Strategy Blueprint
projectIdeas.description: Create a complete content strategy for a brand: audience research, content audit, competitive analysis, editorial calendar, governance framework, and KPI dashboard

projectIdeas.title: Content Measurement Framework
projectIdeas.description: Design a content performance measurement framework with KPIs for each funnel stage, set up tracking in analytics, and produce a monthly reporting template

weeklyMilestones: Understand content strategy fundamentals: audience, goals, channels, and governance
Conduct a content audit and competitive analysis with actionable findings
Build a content calendar and editorial workflow aligned with business goals
Measure content performance with analytics and optimize based on data

web-development.label: Web Development

beginnerResources.title: The Odin Project – Full Stack Curriculum
CS50's Web Programming with Python and JavaScript

intermediateResources.title: MDN Web Docs – Complete Web Development Guide

exercises: Build a responsive landing page from a Figma design using HTML, CSS Grid, and Flexbox that works on mobile, tablet, and desktop
Create a full-stack CRUD application with a React frontend, Node.js/Express backend, and PostgreSQL database with user authentication
Implement a REST API with 5 endpoints including input validation, error handling, pagination, and JWT authentication
Deploy a full-stack application to production using Vercel (frontend) and Railway or Render (backend) with environment variables and a custom domain

projectIdeas.title: Portfolio Website
projectIdeas.description: Design and build a personal portfolio website with responsive design, project showcases, blog integration, contact form, and deploy it to production

projectIdeas.title: Full-Stack SaaS Application
projectIdeas.description: Build a complete SaaS application with user authentication, dashboard, CRUD operations, payments integration (Stripe), and deploy to cloud hosting

weeklyMilestones: Learn HTML semantics and CSS layout (Flexbox, Grid) and build responsive pages
Build interactive UIs with JavaScript and a framework (React, Vue, or Svelte)
Create backend APIs with Node.js/Express and connect to a database
Deploy a full-stack application with CI/CD, custom domain, and production best practices

risk-assessment.label: Risk Assessment & Analysis

beginnerResources.title: Risk Management Professional Certificate
beginnerResources.provider: New York Institute of Finance / edX

intermediateResources.title: Against the Gods: The Remarkable Story of Risk by Peter Bernstein

exercises: Create a risk register for a project you're involved in, identifying 15+ risks with likelihood, impact, mitigation strategies, and risk owners
Perform a quantitative risk analysis using Monte Carlo simulation in Excel or Python for a project budget with 10 uncertain cost items
Conduct a failure mode and effects analysis (FMEA) for a product or process, scoring each failure mode on severity, occurrence, and detection
Design a risk heat map dashboard for an organization showing risk categories, trends, and top 10 risks requiring immediate attention

projectIdeas.title: Enterprise Risk Assessment
projectIdeas.description: Conduct a comprehensive risk assessment for a real or hypothetical project: identify risks, quantify using probability and impact matrices, develop mitigation plans, and create a risk monitoring dashboard

projectIdeas.title: Risk Simulation Tool
projectIdeas.description: Build a Monte Carlo simulation tool in Python that models project risk scenarios, runs 10,000 iterations, and produces probability distributions for cost, schedule, and key outcomes

weeklyMilestones: Learn risk management fundamentals: risk identification, qualitative and quantitative analysis
Build a risk register and heat map for a real project or scenario
Apply quantitative methods: Monte Carlo simulation, decision trees, and expected value analysis
Develop risk mitigation strategies and a monitoring/reporting framework

stakeholder-management.label: Stakeholder Management
exercises: Create a stakeholder map for a current project: identify all stakeholders, classify by power/interest, and define an engagement strategy for each group
Draft 3 versions of a project status update tailored to different audiences: technical team, executive sponsor, and end user
Role-play a difficult stakeholder conversation where you need to push back on scope creep while maintaining the relationship
Design a RACI matrix for a 10-task project with 6 stakeholders and use it to resolve 3 accountability ambiguities

projectIdeas.title: Stakeholder Communication Plan
projectIdeas.description: Develop a comprehensive stakeholder communication plan for a major project, including stakeholder analysis, communication matrix, meeting cadences, escalation paths, and feedback mechanisms

projectIdeas.title: Stakeholder Alignment Workshop
projectIdeas.description: Design and facilitate a 2-hour stakeholder alignment workshop with agenda, activities, decision-making framework, and documented outcomes

weeklyMilestones: Learn stakeholder analysis techniques: power/interest grid, influence mapping, and RACI
Practice tailoring communications to different stakeholder audiences and priorities
Develop negotiation and conflict resolution skills for stakeholder disagreements
Build and execute a stakeholder engagement plan for a real project

agile-methodology.label: Agile Methodology

intermediateResources.title: Scrum: The Art of Doing Twice the Work in Half the Time by Jeff Sutherland

exercises: Break down a feature into user stories using the INVEST criteria and estimate each story using planning poker with a team
Run a 1-week sprint for a personal project: plan a sprint backlog, do daily check-ins, and hold a sprint review and retrospective
Create a product backlog for a hypothetical app with 20+ user stories, prioritized using MoSCoW and estimated in story points
Facilitate a sprint retrospective using the Start/Stop/Continue format and produce 3 actionable improvement items with owners and deadlines

projectIdeas.title: Agile Team Simulation
projectIdeas.description: Run a 4-sprint agile project (real or simulated), tracking velocity, maintaining a burndown chart, conducting all ceremonies, and documenting lessons learned and process improvements

projectIdeas.title: Agile Transformation Plan
projectIdeas.description: Assess a team's current workflow, identify opportunities for agile adoption, design a transition plan with training, ceremonies, and tools, and present the business case

weeklyMilestones: Understand Agile principles, Scrum roles (Product Owner, Scrum Master, Dev Team), and ceremonies
Write user stories, estimate with story points, and create a sprint backlog
Run a complete sprint with daily standups, sprint review, and retrospective
Track velocity, identify impediments, and facilitate continuous improvement

systems-thinking.label: Systems Thinking

beginnerResources.title: Thinking in Systems by Donella Meadows

exercises: Draw a causal loop diagram for a complex problem (e.g., urban traffic congestion) identifying reinforcing and balancing feedback loops
Map the system dynamics of a workplace issue using stock-and-flow diagrams, identifying delays and leverage points
Analyze an unintended consequence of a policy or product decision by tracing cause-and-effect chains across at least 3 system boundaries
Use the iceberg model to analyze a current event: surface events, patterns, underlying structures, and mental models

projectIdeas.title: Systems Analysis Report
projectIdeas.description: Select a complex organizational or social problem, map the system with causal loop diagrams, identify leverage points using Meadows' framework, and propose interventions with expected system-wide effects

projectIdeas.title: Interactive Systems Model
projectIdeas.description: Build an interactive systems model using Loopy or a simulation tool that demonstrates feedback loops and emergent behavior for an educational or business context

weeklyMilestones: Learn systems thinking fundamentals: feedback loops, emergence, stocks and flows, and delays
Draw causal loop diagrams and stock-and-flow diagrams for real-world systems
Identify leverage points using Donella Meadows' 12 leverage points framework
Apply systems thinking to analyze a complex problem and propose high-leverage interventions

exercises: Find and follow a step-by-step project tutorial on YouTube (at least 30 minutes)
Write a 1-page summary of 3 key concepts you learned this week
Teach someone else a concept you learned — explaining solidifies knowledge
Complete a hands-on mini-project applying what you've studied so far

projectIdeas.title: Learning Portfolio
projectIdeas.description: Create a portfolio documenting your learning journey with examples, reflections, and evidence of progress over 4 weeks

projectIdeas.title: Skill Showcase Presentation
projectIdeas.description: Prepare and deliver a 10-minute presentation teaching a concept from this skill area to an audience

weeklyMilestones: Complete your first tutorial and summarize what you learned in writing
Practice the core techniques daily for one week and track your progress
Build a small project applying your new knowledge to a real-world scenario
Share your work with someone else and incorporate their feedback

languages.label: Foreign Languages
exercises: Learn 20 new vocabulary words and practice them in sentences
Have a 10-minute conversation in your target language (even with mistakes)
Watch a TV show in your target language with subtitles and list new words
Write a short journal entry (5-10 sentences) in your target language

projectIdeas.title: Bilingual Content Creator
projectIdeas.description: Create a blog post or video in your target language on a topic you know well

weeklyMilestones: Learn basic greetings and introductions
Hold a simple conversation about daily life
Read a simple article and understand the main idea
Write a structured paragraph without a dictionary

cultural-awareness.label: Cultural Awareness

beginnerResources.title: The Culture Map by Erin Meyer

exercises: Research business etiquette in 3 different countries
Interview someone from a different cultural background about their work norms
Analyze a cross-cultural misunderstanding case study
Attend a cultural event or festival outside your own culture

projectIdeas.title: Cross-Cultural Communication Guide
projectIdeas.description: Create a guide for collaborating with teams from 3 different cultural backgrounds

weeklyMilestones: Understand your own cultural biases
Learn Hofstede's cultural dimensions framework
Practice adapting communication styles
Navigate a real cross-cultural interaction

teamwork.label: Teamwork & Collaboration

beginnerResources.title: Google's Project Aristotle – What Makes Teams Effective

exercises: Lead a team retrospective using Start/Stop/Continue format
Practice giving constructive feedback to a colleague
Collaborate on a shared document or project with clear role assignments
Facilitate a decision-making meeting using a structured method

projectIdeas.title: Team Hackathon
projectIdeas.description: Join or organize a hackathon and work with a team to build something in 24-48 hours

weeklyMilestones: Understand team dynamics and your role
Practice active listening and feedback
Collaborate on a shared project
Reflect on team performance and improve

creativity.label: Creativity & Innovation

intermediateResources.title: Steal Like an Artist by Austin Kleon

exercises: Generate 20 ideas in 10 minutes for solving a specific problem
Do a SCAMPER exercise on an existing product
Create a mind map connecting 3 unrelated topics
Redesign an everyday object to solve a different problem

projectIdeas.title: Innovation Sprint
projectIdeas.description: Pick a real problem, brainstorm 50+ solutions, prototype the best 3, and test with users

weeklyMilestones: Practice divergent thinking techniques
Learn brainstorming frameworks (SCAMPER, Six Hats)
Prototype a creative solution
Get feedback and iterate

time-management.label: Time Management
exercises: Track how you spend every hour for 3 days
Use the Eisenhower Matrix to prioritize your to-do list
Try the Pomodoro Technique for a full work session
Identify and eliminate your top 3 time wasters

projectIdeas.title: Personal Productivity System
projectIdeas.description: Design and implement a personal productivity system tailored to your work style

weeklyMilestones: Audit your current time usage
Implement a prioritization framework
Build a daily routine with focused blocks
Review and optimize your system

networking.label: Professional Networking
exercises: Update your LinkedIn profile with a compelling summary
Reach out to 3 people in your target field for informational interviews
Attend a professional meetup or virtual event and introduce yourself to 5 people
Write a follow-up message to someone you met at an event

projectIdeas.title: Industry Research Interviews
projectIdeas.description: Conduct 5 informational interviews with professionals in your target career and summarize insights

weeklyMilestones: Optimize your LinkedIn profile
Conduct your first informational interview
Attend a professional event
Build a follow-up system

organization.label: Organization & Planning

intermediateResources.title: Getting Things Done by David Allen

exercises: Set up a personal knowledge management system (Notion, Obsidian, or similar)
Create a weekly review checklist and do it for 4 weeks
Organize a workspace (physical or digital) using the 5S method
Build a reference filing system for important documents and notes

projectIdeas.title: Life Dashboard
projectIdeas.description: Create a personal dashboard tracking goals, habits, and projects in a tool like Notion

weeklyMilestones: Set up a personal task management system
Create a filing system for notes and documents
Build a weekly review habit
Refine and maintain the system
